description: Irregularly formed tall vase shaped vessel; body is orange in color with a dripping celadon colored glaze
inscription: Box lid verso: 伊賀炎華　花入　謙仁 with the red seal; 謙仁
text: Though Kishimoto Kennin resides and works in the Mino region, a traditional center of pottery production, he is best known for his works inspired by traditional Iga ceramics, celebrated for their rough texture, weight, and cracked appearance. This vase exemplifies Iga pottery with its orange and moss-green ash glaze and irregular form.
title: Iga-ware blazing-flower vase
